												After (too many) years playing this game, I could sum it up like this :Pros :- Free to Play.- Unique RvRvR gameplay.- Fun fort and open field wars.- Mostly open-world.- Freedom of being able to do whatever you want at any time.- Simple and straightforward.- Nice community.- Free of Asian-MMO nonsense.- Light on system resources.- Premium not directly influencing gameplay.- Linux support.Cons :- Rubbish controls. (eg: not able to rebind spell keys)- Grinding nightmare. (And you need to be fairly high-level (>45) in order to get fun from the RvR.)- Really stale, boring and partially broken combat mechanics.- Omnipresent luck and randomness. (Enjoy having your spells and hits randomly being resisted and evaded for no reason)- Game of numbers with no diminishing returns system of any sort. (Usually the realm with most numbers will always stomp while outnumbered ones will be completely helpless.)- Very dull quest system riddled with bad translations.- Extremely basic guard and mob AI.- No crafting or jobs.- Very limited and crappy character customisation.- Fundamental design flaws leading to perpetual class and map imbalance.- Premium indirectly and increasingly impacting gameplay.- Out of date graphics.- Dull and repetitive sounds/music.- Worriying direction the game is taking (such as ruining RvR by implementing instances).- Support system sucks.- Same map that will appear boring and small after a while.- Not many capturable buildings.- Many hours of boredom before a few minutes of action happen most of the days, at least in the International server.- Not much to do in this game outside of grinding and warring.- Developers track record not really good, and sometimes acting in very unprofessional manners.- Major ignored problems, imbalances and bugs still ruining this game after so many years.- Lacks a ton of polishing in many aspects.- Linux and OpenGL support partially broken, many extra bugs and missing graphical features.I would have recommended this game a few years ago when it still had an interesting and unique potential, however not much improvement, and instead a lot of regressions have happenned in the past few years, while the root issues haven't been cared about so far.So as a conclusion, if you're looking for a well-made polished and complete MMO then you should not even bother with this. If you don't mind most of the aforementioned cons (especially grinding) and look for something simple, you might get some fun and new friends from it.

Short version: Free. MMO. Linux. Surprising quality for beta. 'Nuff said! 8/10, with room for improvement!Long version:Let's get the ugly bits out of the way. This game did not work when I first downloaded it (Linux). I had to reboot a couple times, use the update tool, and then suddenly - success, I got the game to launch! I'm pretty sure the default video mode was unhappy with my dual-monitor setup. This is standard fare for Linux gaming, so I was not dissuaded.Once I had it running, I was very impressed. This game is clearly in beta; there are occasional graphical glitches and inline error codes that really don't impact gameplay at all. Looking beyond this, however, we see a highly immersive and surprisingly well-polished MMO. There are several interesting and unique features that make this game stand out, even when stacked against its more well-funded peers. The regular PvE game is nicely paced and the quests are for the most part easy to follow. From what I've seen, the classes are well-balanced and there are enough features to keep things interesting for a very long time. The postgame feature, 3-way RvR, is a really great idea and stands out in the crowd. I'm not much of a PvP guy, but this system really makes me want try it and stick with it. As it stands now, the game is great, and I love playing it - but the potential for greatness is immense.Graphics: Beautifully done, with a unique art style that stands out. Needs a touch of polish in spots.Sound: Solid all around. Beautiful soundtrack, appropriate effects.Gameplay: Genre standard, well implemented and well delivered. Combat variety abounds.Controls: Intuitive and well-designed. A couple small snags, but nothing frustrating.Replay value: This game is HUGE and just begs you to keep coming back!Final word: TRY IT. If you like MMO, and you can handle a few minor glitches, you'll probably love this game!

The gameplay offers nothing new, and it has terrible graphics.Conclusion:Maybe this game had some potential.But like most games of it's type, it feels like it is simply designed to extract money from you with it's in game currency. The graphics are terrible, the sotryline is terrible, the world and setting are increibly redundant, cliche and boring and feels like it was ripped off the face of hundreds of other fantasty MMORPGs.The gameplay is absolutely abysmal and is incredibly boring and repetitive.Perhaps this game's saving grace could have been it's 'free to play' status.It may be free to play, but it is also pay to win.Maybe you could enjoy this game if you hada few friends, and i have the utmost respect if you wish to play this game. It's free to play, so even if this review didn't convince you to immediately exit the store page, at least you didn't waste any money.This game is your typical moneygrab buggy grindfest. It looks terrible, and it feels terrible. Frankly, it's terrible and you would be better off playing pac-man, which at least has decent gameplay.This is my honest opinion about this game. I know this seems like a huge long hate-rant, and it probably is, but I just can't help but feel this game is a poorly-crafted attempt to squeeze a few cents out of gamers, because I honestly can't see anything worthwhile.

												     My reviews are based off of whether I would recommend the game to the community as a whole.  I personally love this game, but I can't recommend it to everyone.Basis of the Worlds:     There are three areas to choose from: Syrtis; The forested lands, Alsius; the arctic lands, and Ignis; the badlands/desert.  It is built to be a PvP (or rather Realm vs Realm) game the way it it set up; stealing artfacts and capturing towers in the name of your kingdom.       At first glance, each kingdom is well put-together.  You later realise that most of your kingddom is a barren wasteland, with nothing to do but grind enemies.The Community:     The community on here is rather small, but it is both active and kind.Basis of Combat:     There are three classes to choose from: Melee, Archery, and Magic, which can further be divided based on how you wish to play.  It's been a while, so I don't quite remember the class names aside from the warior's subclasses of Knight and Barbarian.     It doesn't get exceedingly difficult as far as combat mechanics go.  It's simply click, click again to attack, and pick a number for a quick technique.The Leveling:     At first, the grind is not as apparent as you'd think.  You tend to level easily for the first ten levels or so upon simply turning in quests.  However, it becomes a monotonous slaughterfest trying to grind out enemies to reach the next level.  Quests begin to be more trouble than reward, so grinding enemies becomes the best option.Pay To Win Aspect:     People see you are able to but items with real money, so they immediatelly critisize the game for being a "pay to win" game.  This couldn't be further from the truth.  There is ONE thing that seems mandetory to buy; that is a mount.  All a mount does is allow for quicker travel IN YOUR OWN KINGDOM, because trying to use a mount in PvP WILL get you killed in most cases.  The most commonly bought items, aside from mounts, are vanities: NO BONUS TRAITS.  I have invested quite a bit of time in this game, not even counting outide of Steam, and I have not ONCE bought an item from the market.  It has a market, but it is not pay to win.Other Notes:     This game has an amazing soundtrack, though there aren't many songs.My Thoughts:     I've invested a decent amount of time in this game, mostly outside of Steam.  I've played as each kingdom, race, and class.  I do like this game.  The RvR aspect doesn't quite speak to me as much as it does many; I simply love partying new people, showing them the ropes and a few tricks, and just chilling listening to music.  I could almost be called the Human NPC.       The game is a very casual game for the most part, until you decide to go into the RvR area.  The combat is pretty much relian on your level, your weapon, and your chosen skills.  Most of the people will be in the upper 40s, 50s, and 60 (which was the cap when I last played), so you will have to be sure to grind a lot before going RvR.     This is one of those games I pay half-attention to.  I watch a movie or just chill in general when I play.  There isn't a need for serious attention unless you're doing RvR.Why I Can't Recommend It:     There are a few reasons as to why I can't recommend this game.     First-Though the community is active, there are nowhere near as much players at a time as a few other MMOs.     Second-While I'm used to grinding, most people will not feel that it's worth it.  It takes a long time.     Third-The quests are nothing special.  Most of the time, you will get a quest with the same structure over and over in different areas, and the rewards become worthless, aside from money.Who Do I Recommend It To:-People looking for a very xasual MMO-People looking for a small but active community to play with-People who don't mind a monotonous grind.I do like this game, and I will continue playing it until the servers shut down, but it's not for everyone.

												     My reviews are based off of whether I would recommend the game to the community as a whole.  I personally love this game, but I can't recommend it to everyone.Basis of the Worlds:     There are three areas to choose from: Syrtis; The forested lands, Alsius; the arctic lands, and Ignis; the badlands/desert.  It is built to be a PvP (or rather Realm vs Realm) game the way it it set up; stealing artfacts and capturing towers in the name of your kingdom.       At first glance, each kingdom is well put-together.  You later realise that most of your kingddom is a barren wasteland, with nothing to do but grind enemies.The Community:     The community on here is rather small, but it is both active and kind.Basis of Combat:     There are three classes to choose from: Melee, Archery, and Magic, which can further be divided based on how you wish to play.  It's been a while, so I don't quite remember the class names aside from the warior's subclasses of Knight and Barbarian.     It doesn't get exceedingly difficult as far as combat mechanics go.  It's simply click, click again to attack, and pick a number for a quick technique.The Leveling:     At first, the grind is not as apparent as you'd think.  You tend to level easily for the first ten levels or so upon simply turning in quests.  However, it becomes a monotonous slaughterfest trying to grind out enemies to reach the next level.  Quests begin to be more trouble than reward, so grinding enemies becomes the best option.Pay To Win Aspect:     People see you are able to but items with real money, so they immediatelly critisize the game for being a "pay to win" game.  This couldn't be further from the truth.  There is ONE thing that seems mandetory to buy; that is a mount.  All a mount does is allow for quicker travel IN YOUR OWN KINGDOM, because trying to use a mount in PvP WILL get you killed in most cases.  The most commonly bought items, aside from mounts, are vanities: NO BONUS TRAITS.  I have invested quite a bit of time in this game, not even counting outide of Steam, and I have not ONCE bought an item from the market.  It has a market, but it is not pay to win.Other Notes:     This game has an amazing soundtrack, though there aren't many songs.My Thoughts:     I've invested a decent amount of time in this game, mostly outside of Steam.  I've played as each kingdom, race, and class.  I do like this game.  The RvR aspect doesn't quite speak to me as much as it does many; I simply love partying new people, showing them the ropes and a few tricks, and just chilling listening to music.  I could almost be called the Human NPC.       The game is a very casual game for the most part, until you decide to go into the RvR area.  The combat is pretty much relian on your level, your weapon, and your chosen skills.  Most of the people will be in the upper 40s, 50s, and 60 (which was the cap when I last played), so you will have to be sure to grind a lot before going RvR.     This is one of those games I pay half-attention to.  I watch a movie or just chill in general when I play.  There isn't a need for serious attention unless you're doing RvR.Why I Can't Recommend It:     There are a few reasons as to why I can't recommend this game.     First-Though the community is active, there are nowhere near as much players at a time as a few other MMOs.     Second-While I'm used to grinding, most people will not feel that it's worth it.  It takes a long time.     Third-The quests are nothing special.  Most of the time, you will get a quest with the same structure over and over in different areas, and the rewards become worthless, aside from money.Who Do I Recommend It To:-People looking for a very xasual MMO-People looking for a small but active community to play with-People who don't mind a monotonous grind.I do like this game, and I will continue playing it until the servers shut down, but it's not for everyone.
